portada.text: A place where past, present, and future intertwine in shadows and whispers. Every door hides a secret, every choice seals a fate. Will you uncover the truth, or become part of the mystery?

inicio.text:
You wake up in an unfamiliar room. The only thing you remember is checking into a hotel. The red velvet carpet, the heavy curtains blocking the light, and the faint scent of dampness feel foreign. On the nightstand, a sealed letter bearing your name waits.

Upon opening it, you recognize the handwriting instantly: yours, but older, steadier.

'If you're reading this, then it's already too late. Trust no one. Do not believe what they tell you. Remember that every choice has a price.'

The signature at the bottom sends a chill down your spine: 'You, Scarlet.'

1A.text:
The fogged-up mirror reveals a young girl, around 8 years old, with facial features eerily similar to yours. She is writing: 'Why did you abandon me?'

The bathtub overflows with black water.

1B.text: Portraits of you at different ages line the hallway walls. At the far end, a woman identical to you is carrying a suitcase toward the elevator. Meanwhile, the door to room 87 is slightly ajar.

2A.text:
You feel something cold around your neck.

The water evaporates, leaving behind a silver necklace engraved with the initials S.S. and the date 18/03/2010. Your accident.

A floating diary drifts open to an entry that reads: 'I did something terrible. No one knows.'

2B.text:
Blood trickles from your hand; the girl in the mirror smiles.

She hands you a faceless doll and whispers: 'Mom locked me in here. Why don't you love me?'

2C.text: You catch the woman in the elevator. Her suitcases are filled with *childhood photos of you.* She presses a button labeled Ψ and mutters: 'This hotel exists because you allow it.'

options.text: Push her aside and take her place.

2D.text:
A projector plays footage of *you* signing a contract, tears streaming down your face. The text on the screen reads:

'I trade one memory for one year of life.'

3A.text: The diary's ashes form a map of the hotel. An 'X' marks room 830. The walls whisper: 'The truth burns more than fire.'

3B.text: The girl leads you to a withered garden where a tree is covered in *photographs of you in alternate lives.* In every one, you are dead, missing, or trapped.

3C.text: The elevator plummets for hours. As you fall, the walls reveal your father crying beside an empty grave. The woman repeats: 'It was your fault.'

3D.text:
Beneath the floor, you find *87 contracts*, all signed by you. The oldest one dates back to 1998—the year you were born.

The hotel manager is... *your future self*.

options.text: Use the key from room 304 on the chest.

4A.text: The girl dissolves into fireflies. A door appears with a sign reading 'Exit.' As you step through, your heart stops for a few seconds.

4B.text: Inside the chest, you find a VHS tape labeled: 'Accident 18/03/2010.' Upon watching it, you realize *you weren’t responsible*.

F-loop.text:
Every time you try to leave, you wake up in room 304. Each time, your reflection grows blurrier, your memories hazier.

In the real world, your family receives an annual letter: 'I'm sorry.'

F-otherSelf.text:
You escape, but now live the life of an alternate version of yourself. Yet in every mirror, you see the woman from the elevator.

One day, the phone rings. You answer: 'Yes, Manager. I'm ready.'

F-debtPaid.text:
Your body fades into the hotel as the girl regains her face.

In the real world, everyone forgets you ever existed.

F-reflectionAccepted.text: You return to reality, but something is wrong. You're no longer in control of your body. The girl now lives your life, while you are merely a spectator.

F-atWhatCost.text:
You escape, but feel no love, no fear, no guilt.

Your family and friends slowly drift away. At night, you hum songs with the girl.

F-warningIgnored.text:
Each time you look in the mirror, your reflection lags behind. Over the years, the delay grows.

The last time you were seen, you were sitting in front of a mirror… waiting for your reflection to blink first.
